org.researchstack.backbone.storage.file

Interface EncryptionProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AesProvider, PinProtectedProvider, UnencryptedPinProvider, UnencryptedProvider

    public interface EncryptionProvider
    This interface is used to create, change, and authenticate pin codes provided by the user.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changePinCode(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String oldPin, java.lang.String newPin)
      Changes the pin code if the old pin provided matches
      void createPinCode(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String pin)
      Create a pin code from the provided input
      Encrypter getEncrypter()
      Returns the Encrypter for data being written to disk, which should be initialized in startWithPassphrase(android.content.Context, java.lang.String).
      boolean hasPinCode(android.content.Context context)
      Returns whether the user has created a pin code.
      void logAccessTime()
      Logs the time of access for deciding whether to re-prompt the user for a pin after having been away from the app for longer than the lock time.
      boolean needsAuth(android.content.Context context, PinCodeConfig codeConfig)
      Returns a boolean indicating whether authentication is needed.
      void startWithPassphrase(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String pin)
      This method should attempt to initialize the Encrypter with the provided pin, otherwise it should throw a StorageAccessException

    • Method Detail

      • hasPinCode

        boolean hasPinCode(android.content.Context context)
        Returns whether the user has created a pin code.
        Parameters:
        context - android context
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether the user has created a pin code

      • createPinCode

        void createPinCode(android.content.Context context,
                   java.lang.String pin)
        Create a pin code from the provided input
        Parameters:
        context - android context
        pin - the pin that the user entered

      • changePinCode

        void changePinCode(android.content.Context context,
                   java.lang.String oldPin,
                   java.lang.String newPin)
        Changes the pin code if the old pin provided matches
        Parameters:
        context - android context
        oldPin - user input for old pin
        newPin - user input for the new pin

      • needsAuth

        boolean needsAuth(android.content.Context context,
                  PinCodeConfig codeConfig)
        Returns a boolean indicating whether authentication is needed. If your Encrypter is not ready, return false.
        Parameters:
        context - android context
        codeConfig - the pin config for the app
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether pin code authorization is needed

      • startWithPassphrase

        void startWithPassphrase(android.content.Context context,
                         java.lang.String pin)
        This method should attempt to initialize the Encrypter with the provided pin, otherwise it should throw a StorageAccessException
        Parameters:
        context - android context
        pin - the pin input from the user

      • logAccessTime

        void logAccessTime()
        Logs the time of access for deciding whether to re-prompt the user for a pin after having been away from the app for longer than the lock time.

      • getEncrypter

        Encrypter getEncrypter()
        Returns the Encrypter for data being written to disk, which should be initialized in startWithPassphrase(android.content.Context, java.lang.String).
        Returns:
        the encrypter
